verses.name: Matthew 27:57
verses.text: When the even was come, there came a rich man of Arimathea, named Joseph, who also himself was Jesus’ disciple:

verses.name: Matthew 27:58
verses.text: He went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.

verses.name: Matthew 27:59
verses.text: And when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

verses.name: Matthew 27:60
verses.text: And laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock: and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre, and departed.

verses.name: Matthew 27:61
verses.text: And there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.
